content.question: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 20, the average temperature of the water in the tub is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>W</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use a left Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>W</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Does this approximation overestimate or underestimate the average temperature of the water over these 20 minutes? Explain your reasoning.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
